name: places/ChIJQbvi_gpZwokRQm6YEvUgoKI
formattedAddress: 310 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 310 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010-4702, USA

originalText.text: I’ve been to Sally spa a few times and it’s been a hit or miss. I’ll start by stating that the operation is very bias toward there black customers. I work at the hospital around the clock most days and this location is convenient, so I run out whenever I can to have some self care. This last experience took the cake. They made me sit there for 45 minutes after telling me the wait is 20 minutes. 2 other patrons come in and said they had an appointment at 5:30p… they arrived at 5:57p. Sally spa first stated it’ll be another 15 minutes or so because they wanted to take the customers that where a half hour late. I explained to them that I’ve been here for a while and it wasn’t fair treatment. They then proceeded to walk away and ignore me without further communication. The only black patron in the entire establishment. I don’t make these allegations lightly, but there has been too many cumulative incidents that occurred. I will never spend my money here ever again.

originalText.text: This place was great! I had a nail break while travelling and they fixed it right up for me. Ada was very gentle with my natural nail and took her time to get it done right. Will definitely come back here for a full manicure next time I’m in town!

text.text: This place was great! I had a nail break while travelling and they fixed it right up for me. Ada was very gentle with my natural nail and took her time to get it done right. Will definitely come back here for a full manicure next time I’m in town!

originalText.text: At first glance looks amazing but once I was seated in the pedicure chair I had buyers remorse. I had to ask her to clean under my nails. She didn't want to scrub my feet but wanted me to pay for extra treatments. They advertise a scrub and gel cream with pedicures which she used less then a tablespoon of for both legs didn't rub it in so it was pointless.Didn't offer to turn on or help understand the massage chair.  Manicure nails were uneven they have a sign that says you choose a free nail product application but it wasn't offered or applied then she took a HOT TOWEL out and applied it directly to my hands before cooling it off. Truly disappointed

originalText.text: Awful gel manicure. I asked for a square shape (they were already shaped really well) and I ended up with all different slants and no cohesiveness. When I asked that they be fixed prior to putting on the nail polish, I was met with attitude. Definitely would not come back

text.text: Awful gel manicure. I asked for a square shape (they were already shaped really well) and I ended up with all different slants and no cohesiveness. When I asked that they be fixed prior to putting on the nail polish, I was met with attitude. Definitely would not come back

originalText.text: One plus about Sally Spa, is that I've never been turned down on a walk-in. They've always been able to take me right away. They have a great sanitary system in which they store your materials (file, slippers, etc) and no one else uses those but you. Their massages are a great add-on and I've always been pleased with the customer service, it's not over the top - and they don't talk much - but look at it this way, you get to relax! The location is clean and relaxing, even with the hustle-and-bustle of NYC right outside. With a bus line on the corner a few steps away and a few blocks walk from the subway, this is a great place to go in Gramercy to get your nails did.
